info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 12:08PM CST until March 12 at 8:19AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Agricultural levee begins to be slightly overtopped. No residences are affected at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 23.0 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 12.3 Sun 11 am 15.4 21.3 23.0 21.0 16.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The NationalWeather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
